declare_formula(relation, *parameters, nameset=None, lock_variable_scope=None, echo=None)ÔÉÅ

Declare a new formula in this universe-of-discourse.

This method is a shortcut for Formula(universe_of_discourse=self, . . d.).

A formula is declared in a theory, and not stated, because it is not a statement, i.e. it is not necessarily true in this theory.

index_symbol(symbol)ÔÉÅ

property inference_rules: InferenceRuleDeclarationDictÔÉÅ

The (possibly empty) collection of inference-rule declared in this in this universe-of-discourse.

Abridged name: i

property o: SimpleObjctDictÔÉÅ

The (possibly empty) collection of simple-objects declared in this in this universe-of-discourse.

Unabridged name: simple_objcts

Well-known simple-objcts are exposed as python properties. In general, a well-known simple-objct is declared in the universe-of-discourse the first time its property is accessed.

property r: RelationDictÔÉÅ

A python dictionary of relations contained in this universe-of-discourse, where well-known relations are directly available as properties.

property relations: RelationDictÔÉÅ

A python dictionary of relations contained in this universe-of-discourse, where well-known relations are directly available as properties.

property simple_objcts: SimpleObjctDictÔÉÅ

The collection of simple-objcts in this universe-of-discourse.

Abridged version: u.o

Well-known simple-objcts are exposed as python properties. In general, a well-known simple-objct is declared in the universe-of-discourse the first time its property is accessed.

Returns:

take_note(t, content, symbol=None, index=None, auto_index=None, dashed_name=None, acronym=None, abridged_name=None, name=None, explicit_name=None, paragraph_header=None, ref=None, subtitle=None, nameset=None, echo=None)ÔÉÅ

v(symbol=None, index=None, auto_index=None, dashed_name=None, acronym=None, abridged_name=None, name=None, explicit_name=None, echo=None)ÔÉÅ

Declare a free-variable in this universe-of-discourse.

This method is expected to be as in a with statement, it yields an instance of FreeVariable, and automatically lock the variable scope when the with left.

Example: with u.v(‚Äòx‚Äô) as x, u.v(‚Äòy‚Äô) as y: some code‚Ä¶

To manage variable scope extensions and locking expressly, use declare_free_variable() instead.
